abstract.p: McLain Ward wins speed jumping event to close I Love New York Horse Show, Lake Placid (S)

block.p: McLain Ward of Brewster, N.Y., rode Naomi to victory in the Whiteface Mountain Speed Stake to close the 23rd annual I Love New York Horse Show in Lake Placid.
Ward and Naomi were the first to try the 11-jump, one-round course at the North Elba Show Grounds. They completed the course without penalty in 52.815 seconds to set the time to beat.
McLain Ward of Brewster, N.Y., rode Naomi to victory in the Whiteface Mountain Speed Stake to close the 23rd annual I Love New York Horse Show in Lake Placid.
Ward and Naomi were the first to try the 11-jump, one-round course at the North Elba Show Grounds. They completed the course without penalty in 52.815 seconds to set the time to beat.

None of the remaining entries could match Ward's time on Naomi. The closest challenge came from Margie Goldstein-Engle of Wellington, Fla. Goldstein-Engle, one of 12 finalists for the United States Equestrian Team's Olympic show jumping squad, finished without penalty in 55.648 seconds on Hidden Creek's Limerick.
Third place went to Ward on Oky Doky with a time of 56.501.
